caller_intent: Jacqui Watson wants to add her 15-year-old son Darian Watson to her auto insurance policy after receiving a notice from Alliance Insurance, despite him not having a driver's license yet.
resolution_steps: Jamie verifies Jacqui's policy details (Progressive auto policy with 2020 GMC Terrain).
Jamie collects Darian's full name, date of birth, and confirms he is not yet a driver.
Jamie adds Darian as a 'household member' on the policy without changing the premium.
Explains that Darian will remain a non-rated driver until he obtains a license, at which point he would need to be updated to a 'rated driver' with a permit number.
Offers to store the permit number in the system if provided now or note it for future reference.
knowledge_required: Differentiation between household members and rated drivers
Process for adding new drivers to auto policies
Impact of driver's license status on insurance rates
systems_referenced: Alliance Insurance internal policy management system
summary: Jacqui Watson contacted Alliance Insurance to add her 15-year-old son Darian to her auto policy after receiving a notice. Jamie verified her policy, added Darian as a household member (non-rated driver), and explained that future updates would require his permit number when he obtains a license. The process was completed without premium changes at this stage.
